title: Firecracker Meatballs
directions: Adjust rack to top and middle positions. Heat to 425 degrees.
Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens. Mince whites. Peel and mince ginger.
In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, honey, 4 tsp soy sauce, and sriracha to taste. Set aside.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium-high heat. Add half the sesame seeds. Cook, stirring, until golden brown, 1 - 2 minutes.
Add rice, 1 1/2 cups of water, and a big pinch of salt. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15- 18 minutes. Keep covered off heat until read to serve.
In a second large bowl, combine beef, panko, ginger, scallion whites, remaining soy sauce, salt (1 tsp), and pepper. Form into 10-12 1.5" meatballs.

Place meatballs on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Toss green beans with a drizzle of oil, salt, and pepper on a second lightly oiled baking sheet. Cook green beans on top rack and meatballs on bottom rack for 14 - 16 minutes.
Fluff rice with a fork. Season with salt and pepper.
Carefully add meatballs to bowl with sauce and toss to coat.
Divide between bowls or plates. Top rice with meatballs. Drizzle with any remaining sauce. Serve green beans to the side. Garnish with scallion greens, remaining sesame seeds, and chili flakes.
